Comments_List: I learned about the application and use of differential equations in real life. I learned about topics such as heat transfer, Laplacian operators, and Euler functions. Many of the topics covered will help me as I progress through the curriculum required for my major.
I learned basic techniques for solving differential equations.
A good fundamental understanding of differential equations and partial differential equations.
I learned how differential equations applied to real world situations as well as how to solve them.

Not that this is an aspect of the the occurs that can be improved as a summer session, but as we moved into the more difficult topics it was very fast paced. Keeping up with the class towards the end of the session was more difficult.
It was pretty great. A lot of material in a short time, but that cannot be helped in a summer course.
The class is well taught and clear.
I wouldn't recommend this class as one to take unless it is required. It is difficult material and if a student doesn't need it for their major it would be a lot of work for no reason.
Yes, absolutely. If a student needs or wants to learn differential equations, this is a great starting point.
I would because I was able to focus all of my efforts on learning about the material.
